title: (x) Mormon Missionary Nametag - engraved lettering {Raph}
content:
Hola, folks. I'd appreciate a little assistance in trying to identify a certain font.   
   
 [http://www.shunn.net/mormon/terror/img/nametag.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063353/http:/www.shunn.net/mormon/terror/img/nametag.gif)   
   
The first line, not the serifed font below.   
   
I've looked it up on a font identifier, which told me Avenir and Arial Curved Bold, neither of which can actually work for this font, as their O's are round and larger than the average letter. I don't think it's monospaced, but I could be wrong. Here's another sample:   
   
 [http://mikeli.image.pbase.com/u6/jhales/small/981811.John11701003.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063353/http:/mikeli.image.pbase.com/u6/jhales/small/981811.John11701003.jpg)   
   
Thanks in advance.
author: anonymous

comments.content: [FF DIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/) has a better range of weights that gets closer to the look.

It's not really a font, it's engraved lettering. I wouldn't be surprised if it were something like [standard style](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063353/http:/www.scottmachine.com/scott.htm) of a Scott Master Engraving Font. That said, I would be shocked if there weren't DTP fonts (probably free) around.
Thanks....that's definitely closer than Avenir or Arial Curved Bold. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063353im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

The "R" doesn't match with anything I've found so far: the sample   
looks very much like [Helvetica Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018063353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica/helvetica-47-light-condensed/testdrive.html?s=ELDER%20SHUNN&p=36), but the "R" seems to   
be News Gothic/Trade Gothic.
Looks more like DIN to me.
